item.title: Randi add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Randi add a quote by Charles Schultz
item.description: "Try not to have a good time...this is supposed to be educational." -- Charles Schultz

item.title: Randi add a quote by Jim Rohn
item.description: "Formal education will make you a living; self-education will make you a fortune." -- Jim Rohn

item.title: Randi add a quote by ROBERT FROST
item.description: "I am not a teacher, but an awakener." -- ROBERT FROST

item.title: Randi add a quote by Jacques Barzun
item.description: "Teaching is not a lost art, but the regard for it is a lost tradition." -- Jacques Barzun

item.title: Randi add a quote by Henri Frederic Amiel
item.description: "To know how to suggest is the art of teaching." -- Henri Frederic Amiel

item.title: Randi add a quote by Pete Seeger
item.description: "Do you know the difference between education and experience? Education is when you read the fine print; experience is what you get when you don't. " -- Pete Seeger

item.title: Randi add a quote by Ezra Pound
item.description: "Real education must ultimately be limited to men who insist on knowing. The rest is mere sheep herding." -- Ezra Pound

item.title: Randi add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "Writers are always selling somebody out." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Randi add a quote by Saddam Hussein
item.description: "Women make up one half of society. Our society will remain backward and in chains unless its women are liberated, enlightened and educated." -- Saddam Hussein

item.title: Randi add a quote by Joan of Arc
item.description: "One life is all we have and we live it as we believe in living it. But to sacrifice what you are and to live without belief, that is a fate more terrible than dying." -- Joan of Arc

item.title: Randi add a quote by Bill Keane
item.description: "Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is a gift of God, which is why we call it the present." -- Bill Keane

item.title: Randi add a quote by Confucius
item.description: "It is not the failure of others to appreciate your abilities that should trouble you, but rather your failure to appreciate theirs." -- Confucius

item.title: Randi add a quote by Frances Willard
item.description: "The world is wide, and I will not waste my life in friction when it could be turned into momentum. " -- Frances Willard

item.title: Randi add a quote by charles de lint
item.description: "Every time you do a good deed you shine the light a little farther into the dark. And the thing is, when you're gone that light is going to keep shining on, pushing the shadows back." -- charles de lint

item.title: Randi add a quote by charles de lint
item.description: "I don't want to live in the kind of world where we don't look out for each other. Not just the people that are close to us, but anybody who needs a helping hand. I cant change the way anybody else thinks, or what they choose to do, but I can do my bit." -- charles de lint

item.title: Randi add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "I long to accomplish a great and noble task, but it is my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Randi add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "People pay for what they do, and still more for what they have allowed themselves to become. And they pay for it very simply; by the lives they lead." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Randi add a quote by Lee Ezell
item.description: "Pray to God, but row towards shore." -- Lee Ezell

item.title: Randi add a quote by Marian Wright Edelman
item.description: "Service is the rent we pay for being. It is the very purpose of life, and not something you do in your spare time." -- Marian Wright Edelman

item.title: Randi add a quote by W. Clement Stone
item.description: "When you discover your mission, you will feel its demand. It will fill you with enthusiasm and a burning desire to get to work on it." -- W. Clement Stone

item.title: Randi add a quote by Albert Pike
item.description: "What we have done for ourselves alone dies with us; what we have done for others and the world remains and is immortal." -- Albert Pike

item.title: Randi add a quote by Simone de Beauvoir
item.description: "That's what I consider true generosity: You give your all, and yet you always feel as if it costs you nothing." -- Simone de Beauvoir

item.title: Randi add a quote by Warren Buffett
item.description: "If youâ€™re in the luckiest one per cent of humanity, you owe it to the rest of humanity to think about the other 99 per cent." -- Warren Buffett
